revised_title: Observations on the Late Comet in September and October 1757
tldr: The author, D. Klinkenberg, shares his observations of the comet that appeared in September and October 1757, made at the Hague. He discusses the comet's positions, perihelion, and orbit, and compares it to previous comets. Klinkenberg also mentions his attempts to observe the fixed stars and the moon to understand the velocity of the Earth's diurnal motion on its axis.
